definitions: To permit or tolerate the occurrence of errors or unsuccessful outcomes within a system or process, often as a deliberate design choice to enhance resilience or learning.
To design a system or process in such a way that it can continue to function or recover even when certain components or attempts fail.
examples: We decided to allow_failure in the experimental phase to gather more data.
The new software is designed to allow_failure without crashing.
By allowing_failure, the team learned valuable lessons.
